customUrl.description: Provide custom nocodb app base url

get.description: List of all rows from Zone table and response data fields can be filtered based on query params.

parameters.description:
Allows you to fetch records that are currently visible within a specific view.

Views:
* vw43dwdr3xswhbsv - Default view
* vwqj5ccgz7x02y3i - Countries
* vw27vufl67az4v5h - Distribution Zones
* vw74ss2146qnca71 - Townships
parameters.name: viewId
fields
parameters.description: Array of field names or comma separated filed names to include in the response objects. In array syntax pass it like `fields[]=field1&fields[]=field2` or alternately `fields=field1,field2`.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Comma separated field names to sort rows, rows will sort in ascending order based on provided columns. To sort in descending order provide `-` prefix along with column name, like `-field`. Example : `sort=field1,-field2`

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: This can be used for filtering rows, which accepts complicated where conditions. For more info visit [here](https://docs.nocodb.com/developer-resources/rest-apis#comparison-operators). Example : `where=(field1,eq,value)`

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The `limit` parameter used for pagination, the response collection size depends on limit value with default value `25` and maximum value `1000`, which can be overridden by environment variables `DB_QUERY_LIMIT_DEFAULT` and `DB_QUERY_LIMIT_MAX` respectively.

parameters.name: shuffle
parameters.description: The `shuffle` parameter used for pagination, the response will be shuffled if it is set to 1.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The `offset` parameter used for pagination, the value helps to select collection from a certain index.

post.description: Insert a new row in table by providing a key value pair object where key refers to the column alias. All the required fields should be included with payload excluding `autoincrement` and column with default value.

patch.description: Partial update row in table by providing a key value pair object where key refers to the column alias. You need to only include columns which you want to update.

delete.description: Delete a row by using the **primary key** column value.

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: Primary key of the record you want to read. If the table have composite primary key then combine them by using `___` and pass it as primary key.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Array of field names or comma separated filed names to include in the response objects. In array syntax pass it like `fields[]=field1&fields[]=field2` or alternately `fields=field1,field2`.

get.description: Read a row data by using the **primary key** column value.

parameters.description:
Allows you to fetch records that are currently visible within a specific view.

Views:
* vw43dwdr3xswhbsv - Default view
* vwqj5ccgz7x02y3i - Countries
* vw27vufl67az4v5h - Distribution Zones
* vw74ss2146qnca71 - Townships
parameters.name: viewId

get.description: Get rows count of a table by applying optional filters.

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: This can be used for filtering rows, which accepts complicated where conditions. For more info visit [here](https://docs.nocodb.com/developer-resources/rest-apis#comparison-operators). Example : `where=(field1,eq,value)`

parameters.name: linkFieldId
parameters.description:
**Links Field Identifier** corresponding to the relation field `Links` established between tables.

Link Columns:
* ce19bme4uy6d5h9 - Contains Areas
* crchwow9pqhe78o - Actors
* cvy23o27xc6bz9n - Analysis
* co92u1gp84qx6qn - Interactions

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: Primary key of the record you want to read. If the table have composite primary key then combine them by using `___` and pass it as primary key.

get.description: This API endpoint allows you to retrieve list of linked records for a specific `Link field` and `Record ID`. The response is an array of objects containing Primary Key and its corresponding display value.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Array of field names or comma separated filed names to include in the response objects. In array syntax pass it like `fields[]=field1&fields[]=field2` or alternately `fields=field1,field2`.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Comma separated field names to sort rows, rows will sort in ascending order based on provided columns. To sort in descending order provide `-` prefix along with column name, like `-field`. Example : `sort=field1,-field2`

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: This can be used for filtering rows, which accepts complicated where conditions. For more info visit [here](https://docs.nocodb.com/developer-resources/rest-apis#comparison-operators). Example : `where=(field1,eq,value)`

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The `limit` parameter used for pagination, the response collection size depends on limit value with default value `25` and maximum value `1000`, which can be overridden by environment variables `DB_QUERY_LIMIT_DEFAULT` and `DB_QUERY_LIMIT_MAX` respectively.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The `offset` parameter used for pagination, the value helps to select collection from a certain index.

post.description: This API endpoint allows you to link records to a specific `Link field` and `Record ID`. The request payload is an array of record-ids from the adjacent table for linking purposes. Note that any existing links, if present, will be unaffected during this operation.

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: Primary key of the record you want to read. If the table have composite primary key then combine them by using `___` and pass it as primary key.

delete.description:
This API endpoint allows you to unlink records from a specific `Link field` and `Record ID`. The request payload is an array of record-ids from the adjacent table for unlinking purposes. Note that, 
- duplicated record-ids will be ignored.
- non-existent record-ids will be ignored.

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: Primary key of the record you want to read. If the table have composite primary key then combine them by using `___` and pass it as primary key.

parameters.name: shuffle
parameters.description: The `shuffle` parameter used for pagination, the response will be shuffled if it is set to 1.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The `offset` parameter used for pagination, the value helps to select collection from a certain index.

parameters.name: nested[Actor][fields]
parameters.description: Array of field names or comma separated filed names to include in the in nested column `Actor` result. In array syntax pass it like `fields[]=field1&fields[]=field2.`. Example : `nested[Actor][fields]=field1,field2`

post.description: Insert a new row in table by providing a key value pair object where key refers to the column alias. All the required fields should be included with payload excluding `autoincrement` and column with default value.

patch.description: Partial update row in table by providing a key value pair object where key refers to the column alias. You need to only include columns which you want to update.

delete.description: Delete a row by using the **primary key** column value.

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: Primary key of the record you want to read. If the table have composite primary key then combine them by using `___` and pass it as primary key.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Array of field names or comma separated filed names to include in the response objects. In array syntax pass it like `fields[]=field1&fields[]=field2` or alternately `fields=field1,field2`.

get.description: Read a row data by using the **primary key** column value.

parameters.description:
Allows you to fetch records that are currently visible within a specific view.

Views:
* vwrvneriqexypzjm - Default view
parameters.name: viewId

get.description: Get rows count of a table by applying optional filters.

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: This can be used for filtering rows, which accepts complicated where conditions. For more info visit [here](https://docs.nocodb.com/developer-resources/rest-apis#comparison-operators). Example : `where=(field1,eq,value)`

parameters.name: linkFieldId
parameters.description:
**Links Field Identifier** corresponding to the relation field `Links` established between tables.

Link Columns:
* czhttvyt50wtc9b - Actor

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: Primary key of the record you want to read. If the table have composite primary key then combine them by using `___` and pass it as primary key.

get.description: This API endpoint allows you to retrieve list of linked records for a specific `Link field` and `Record ID`. The response is an array of objects containing Primary Key and its corresponding display value.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Array of field names or comma separated filed names to include in the response objects. In array syntax pass it like `fields[]=field1&fields[]=field2` or alternately `fields=field1,field2`.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Comma separated field names to sort rows, rows will sort in ascending order based on provided columns. To sort in descending order provide `-` prefix along with column name, like `-field`. Example : `sort=field1,-field2`

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: This can be used for filtering rows, which accepts complicated where conditions. For more info visit [here](https://docs.nocodb.com/developer-resources/rest-apis#comparison-operators). Example : `where=(field1,eq,value)`

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The `limit` parameter used for pagination, the response collection size depends on limit value with default value `25` and maximum value `1000`, which can be overridden by environment variables `DB_QUERY_LIMIT_DEFAULT` and `DB_QUERY_LIMIT_MAX` respectively.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The `offset` parameter used for pagination, the value helps to select collection from a certain index.

post.description: This API endpoint allows you to link records to a specific `Link field` and `Record ID`. The request payload is an array of record-ids from the adjacent table for linking purposes. Note that any existing links, if present, will be unaffected during this operation.

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: Primary key of the record you want to read. If the table have composite primary key then combine them by using `___` and pass it as primary key.

delete.description:
This API endpoint allows you to unlink records from a specific `Link field` and `Record ID`. The request payload is an array of record-ids from the adjacent table for unlinking purposes. Note that, 
- duplicated record-ids will be ignored.
- non-existent record-ids will be ignored.

parameters.name: recordId
parameters.description: Primary key of the record you want to read. If the table have composite primary key then combine them by using `___` and pass it as primary key.

column_name.description: the value of the given column
